Mr. Bean.Action: Leaves fake legs to deceive a policeman while stealing a car and drives away smugly, showing disregard for rules and others.
Uses fake legs to trick a policeman into thinking he is repairing his car, then cleverly unlocks and drives away.
Drives at a frightening speed over sleeping policemen bumps with a smug, confident look.
Uses a metal comb creatively to measure an alley and drives his car through it, navigating traffic cleverly.
Drives his car illegally through Harrods, ignoring the rules and possibly inconveniencing others.
Uses a metal comb to precisely measure the alley width before driving his car through it, resulting in a perfect fit and sparks flying from the doors.
Drives his car through the double doors of Harrods to bypass traffic, cleverly timing the security guard's patrol.
Plays theme music on an old record player strapped in the car, causing disruptions (record scratches) due to car movement on rough roads.
Looks concerned at the scene of an accident.
Smiling broadly after parking his Mini outside the National Gallery.
Prepares a 'Doctor on Call' sign and props (bone and skull) on his Mini, then heads into work smiling.
Mimics characters in portraits, interacts with his surroundings in a playful but harmless way.
Accidentally causes the special light in the Da Vinci cartoon room to flood the artwork with damaging white light, then quietly turns the light off and leaves.
Offers breath freshener to others in the elevator.
Sniffs unpleasant smell from person next to him.
Forces breath freshener upon Vincent, an elderly gentleman, who is mortified.
Turns off light and closes doors to keep things tidy as he walks along corridor.
Looks snootily at man working on computer and walks on.
Nods in agreement when asked about finding a painting, showing willingness to help.
Uses sculptures as stepping stones and slides, demonstrating playful creativity and enthusiasm.
Brings back the correct painting, helping others and earning their praise.
Ceremoniously hands SUIT MAN the Van Hocht painting and laughs delightedly at praise.
Turns off a light to save electricity, indicating his dislike of waste.
Accidentally unplugs computer system but immediately tries to fix it and shows relief together with the Programmer.
Overwhelmed and happy about being sent to America for a new opportunity.
Imitates a bowlegged cowboy, playfully using imaginary guns and sound effects, showing childlike joy.
Receives wonderful news of being assigned to America despite apparent doubts from colleagues.
Walks through the National Gallery acting out a cowboy, making imaginary guns and sounds, seemingly oblivious to surroundings.

Quickly thinks to physically cover the breasts in the paintings and statue to protect the girls from seeing nudity, including improvising by removing his shoes and belt to increase reach and coverage.
Fails to anticipate the large painting behind the girls and cannot cover all areas effectively; his efforts are ultimately futile and lead to embarrassment when his trousers fall down.
Locks the door carefully and hides the key under a garden gnome, ensuring security before leaving.
Makes a silly face at the airport check-in lady to help her recognize him, resulting in friendly interaction.
Is very touched upon being moved to first class, showing sincere gratitude.
Waves smoke away and tries to symbolically move cigar smoke aside to avoid discomfort to others in the lounge.
Uses a paper bag to catch cigar smoke and dispose of it in trash bin, showing consideration for others' comfort.
Displays passive-aggressive behavior by putting a plastic mug on his face and breathing heavily to show displeasure at cigar smoke.
Tries various imaginative methods to avoid cigar smoke: waves hands, mimics cutting up smoke, covers face with a plastic mug, and catches smoke in a paper bag to discard.
Fails to stop the cigar smoker or influence his behavior despite persistent efforts.
Adds two more stars on the TEDDY HOTEL sign as a treat.
Secures all belongings with padlocks and string, displaying excessive caution.
Dunks a cigar into an old woman's cup of tea to impede the cigar smoker, causing discomfort to both.
Pushes violently to fit his luggage into the overhead compartment already occupied by an old lady's case, causing suspicious looks.
Smiles merrily and tries to clink glasses with his unsmiling neighbor, attempting to engage positively.
Attempts to impress neighbor by skillfully catching nuts but receives no response.
Turns on noisy air blower and inadvertently blows it towards his neighbor, showing lack of consideration.
Places a spitball in the air blower causing champagne to spray all over neighbor, resulting in a negative interaction.
Pushes luggage violently into overhead locker despite risking damage and upsetting the old lady.
Attempts to impress seat neighbor by performing a practiced skill (catching nuts in mouth) to break the ice.
Turns on noisy air blower and accidentally directs it at neighbor, then fails to fix the problem properly.
Comes up with an idea to block air blower with a spitball, which backfires and creates a mess for his neighbor.
Tries to cheer the sick boy up with playful antics like pretending to be a cowboy and American cop.
Blows into the boy's sick-bag and puts it in another person's face.
Tries various playful antics, such as lizard impersonation and throwing sweets to entertain the boy.
Pockets the sweets and inflates the bag to pop it, but finds it's got a hole so the plan fails.
Uses the boy's sick-bag as a prop to amuse REYNOLDS, blowing into it and timing the action well for comic effect.
Attempts to appear daring and brave on the moving walkway, engages in playful imaginary role-play despite the tense situation with cops.
Flustered and tries to get away when cops react to his actions, ends up running from them.
Pretends to have a gun by miming with his fingers to comply with police instructions and avoid escalation.
Frozen and terrified when confronted by police, showing vulnerability rather than aggression.
Does not react aggressively or push away the old lady who kicks him in the shins, showing tolerance to mistreatment.
Fakes putting a gun on the floor and complies with police instructions, showing calmness under pressure.
Freezes terrified when surrounded by cops with guns trained on him.
Is physically kicked by an old lady and generally fails to avoid trouble in the airport.
Finds the hidden key cleverly concealed under a garden ornament by noticing it is an obvious hiding spot.
Enters the house quietly, notices the pre-alarm timer and finds the hidden magnetic key under the alarm unit just in time to disable the alarm.
Plays with the light switch rapidly, causing the house lights to flash on and off madly, attracting attention unnecessarily.
Puts on a walkman happily and moves to the rhythm, locks the door, turns on the alarm, and turns off the hall light
Turns off the bathroom light that should not be on.
Eats strawberries from the fridge without asking, then puts one back after tasting it off.
Turns off the kitchen light silently as David comes out, indirectly causing David to stub his toe.
Turns off the light when noticing it should not be on.
Eats strawberries from the fridge but quickly rejects one that tastes off.
Leaves the bathroom wearing headphones and moves through the house largely unobserved.
Turns off the kitchen light unexpectedly, causing David to stub his toe.
Fishes electric toothbrush out of toilet and carefully places it back on the shelf.
Uses David's water to wash his socks without asking.
Smiles at the happy family photograph on the wall, showing an appreciation for warmth and happiness.
Quietly takes the family photograph from the wall and removes it to a bedroom labeled 'JENNIFER' without notifying anyone.
Washes his socks in David's water and quietly takes a family photograph from the wall without being noticed.
Waves to the family friendly while leaving Jennifer's bedroom, slippily carries his belongings, smiles and grunts in greeting during breakfast.
Silently slips into the bathroom again without explanation after surprising the family.
Breezes out of Jennifer's bedroom in pajamas carrying a wash bag and towel, calmly slipping into the bathroom amid family confusion.
Does not verbally explain or clarify the situation to the family despite obvious confusion and concern, leading to discomfort and uncertainty.
Hangs up happily and offers help to the family.
Yanks on the hand-brake suddenly causing David to hit the windshield.
Smiles at Annie and gives her a little wave, receiving a sweet wave back and positive attention from her.
Fastens his seat belt promptly when the car crashes, showing awareness and caution.
Bangs car door hard against an expensive car’s bodywork, showing clumsiness and lack of control.
Keeps a smile and waves politely to Annie, creating a positive social impression despite awkwardness.
Stops to admire a tasteful and romantic painting, shows interest and smiles.
Gestures politely indicating he would like to tidy himself up before meeting Mr. Grierson.
Stops to admire a painting attentively and shows interest in a detail (the padlock) rather than the overall art.
Shakes his head when asked if he knows the painting, indicating lack of knowledge.
Gestures that he'd like to tidy himself up and takes time before meeting, showing awareness of personal presentation.
Uses exaggerated and awkward behavior to hide embarrassment when caught in compromising situations in the bathroom.

Struggles to dry soaked trousers due to bad luck and poor situational control, repeatedly caught in awkward situations by other men entering the washroom, has to pretend strange explanations to cover himself.
Eventually has a brainwave to climb on two sinks to position himself exactly under the hand drying machine, successfully using available resources creatively to solve the problem.
Smiles after the man leaves, showing a positive reaction.
Rushes to the sink to soothe his pain but soaks himself again, showing vulnerability and self-care.
Leaves uneasily hunched to hide his wet patch, indicating discomfort and a desire to avoid drawing attention or embarrassment.
Carries a newspaper awkwardly in front of his flies during introduction, showing social awkwardness but no negative intent.
Performs a 'nifty handchange' to properly shake hands while hiding his wet patch.
Pretends to be changing a light bulb to cover a compromising position, calmly removes and polishes the bulb.
Scalds his fingers on the hot bulb, then soaks himself again accidentally while cooling his fingers.
Attempts to hide a large wet patch on his clothes uneasily while interacting with others.
Performs a 'nifty handchange' to free the correct hand for handshake while maintaining concealment of the wet patch.
Holds the newspaper in front of his flies to disguise the wet patch.
Sits closely behind David, walking tightly in rhythm with him, showing synchrony and implicit cooperation.
Fails to follow promptly and ends up stuck on wrong side of the room, showing lapse in attention.
Politely declines invitation to look at computer system by saying 'Ahm ... NO.'
Moves around room to switch on fan, amusingly doing a strange rhythmic dance to keep wind on his trousers.
Boasts proudly with a crotch-thrusting walk after noticing his trousers are dry.
Does not notice Annie's love message and blows his nose on it, then discards it without acknowledgment.
Shows interest in the mime artist's performance and interacts without malice, poking the mime's nose out of curiosity.
Unimpressed by the mime's tricks, takes hanky directly from mime’s trousers without hesitation.
Responds to mime’s playful mocking gun duel with serious intent, settling it decisively.
Performs an elaborate imaginary gun show that scares the MIME away, then seems pleased with himself.
Thumps the passenger door loudly into the side of an expensive car next-door.
Turns off a running car left unattended with keys in the ignition and tries to return the keys to nearby people.
Sets up an elaborate imaginary big gun with detailed parts and performs a convincing mime, intimidating the MIME effectively.
Carefully identifies the source of the throbbing noise in a nearby car, notices the engine running and keys in ignition, thoughtfully turns off the engine and takes the keys out to prevent theft.
Despite a warning from David to stay out of trouble, plays with car dashboard buttons and controls, showing a lack of restraint.
Offers car keys to passing people with groceries as if to help them.
Mocks and plays with the robber by acting like a mime, taunting him and delaying his escape.
Takes the gun from the robber and waves it in his face, reprimanding him for breaking rules.
Counts aloud and signals to the robber to draw, distracting him with confidence despite danger.
Feigns running away but actually runs on the spot mimicking a mime, confusing the robber.
Takes the gun from the robber and waves it in his face, successfully intimidating him.
Counts aloud and uses a playful draw game to distract and stall the robber until help arrives.
Offers car keys to people near cars, pretending not to notice the robber situation initially.
Throws the gun away to prevent harm, kicks it away from the robber, tries to help avoid dangerous violence.
Swaps the robber's bag with that of an old bag lady, causing some money to spill out.
Puts his arm around the robber and gets him to take a photograph together, revealing a friendly, humanizing gesture.
Waves goodbye to the robber as he drives away, displaying a gentle, non-hostile attitude.
Passers-by applaud and whistle him, calling him a hero for his actions.
Hands over the robber's gun to a police officer.
Notices the lady walking away with the swapped bag but decides not to tell her, avoiding further attention.
Calmly tears the photo of himself with the robber and returns half to police, keeping the other half.
Passers-by applaud and whistle, calling him a hero; he hands over the gun to a cop, seemingly unintentionally involved but compliant.
Notices he has swapped bags with the robber but chooses not to inform the lady to avoid attention.
In police interview, remains calm despite intimidation and tears the photo in half, asserting some control.
Looks blankly when questioned about critical details like the robber and stolen money, showing lack of understanding.
Grins happily, answers a question with enthusiasm.
Shows interest and delight in the computer game, joins Kevin in playful activity by wearing a goblin hat and singing along.
Calmly takes the picture from the robber and cleverly tears it in half, keeping one half with himself.
Grins happily and confidently answers a question he can understand.
Appears uncertain and hesitant when asked about computers, responding with 'Ahm...'.
Shows interest and delight in the computer game but does not demonstrate understanding or skill.
Involved in playful problem solving with Kevin, shares success by making Winkle interact with the game, enjoys Kevin's praise and delight.
Enters a tense domestic scene casually wearing a pointy hat, helps himself to melon without interaction or acknowledgment, then grins and leaves.
Notices the frog on the screen and repeatedly clicks it, triggering the frog to jump and drop the key.
Uses the stone to throw at the cuckoo clock, successfully making it drop the key.
Grins and enjoys Kevin’s praise, showing confidence in his success.
Enters the room and helps himself to a melon, wearing a pointy hat, showing disregard for social norms or context.
Gives David an affable smile and allows him to enter his room and look through his personal photo album.
Creates a private space with washing hanging across the room, somewhat obstructive and solitary environment.
Labels a picture 'Bean & Family' placing a Polaroid of himself next to a family photo, unaware of its sadness.
Waves good-bye a little rudely to David after he tries to say good night.
Carefully organizes and labels photos and memorabilia, showing methodical attention to detail.
Takes photos at famous UK locations but fails to include himself properly, indicating lack of technical skill or planning.
Finds the specific photo he was looking for in the album, demonstrating focus and purpose.
Waves good-bye rudely to David, showing social awkwardness and lack of interpersonal skills.
Happily soaping himself while wearing Alison's shower cap, indicating a playful and lighthearted side.
Avoids engaging in a deep conversation about understanding people by looking at his watch and walking away when asked by David.
Carefully dials the phone.
Sets up an elaborate Rube Goldberg-style mechanism to turn off the TV with the ringing phone.
Thinks hard about a philosophical question but quickly looks at his watch and leaves instead of engaging thoughtfully.
Nods along patiently while David talks about emotional healing, though not emotionally engaged.
Accompanies David and Elmer to the gallery, showing willingness to participate despite personal distraction.
Swallows hard nervously under Elmer’s glare, showing vulnerability and compliance rather than hostility.
Nods along to conversation, but is distracted by a gherkin in his bun and picks it out with his fingers.
Follows David and Elmer through gallery corridors, elevator, and arrives calmly at highly secured area despite Elmer's intimidating presence.
Carefully inspects the painting, shows appreciation and concern for its cleanliness.
Panics and wipes the painting after sneezing on it.
Panics and tries various ways to fix the ink stain on the painting, showing concern for the artwork.
Devises a clever but deceptive plan to move the damaged painting by disguising it as a trolley and faking a squeaky noise to avoid suspicion.
Allows a very thin woman who cannot fit in the elevator to remain outside without offering help or adjusting the situation.
Checks his watch nonchalantly and drums his fingers, showing a degree of impatience or detachment towards others.
When leaving the men's room after washing the painting, mimics 'Sorry, Sorry,' suggesting a polite acknowledgement to those waiting.
Attempts to rescue Whistler's Mother painting precariously balanced outside the window, shoos away birds, and risks falling to retrieve it.
Carefully tries to clean and restore the damaged painting using solvent, showing concern for the artwork.
Freezes in horror seeing the painting's face being removed, indicating sensitivity and emotional reaction.
Desperately tries to redraw the painting's face despite his limited skill, showing effort to make things right.
Shows concern and tries to calm David down despite the chaotic situation.
Feels hurt by David’s negative imagining of consequences, indicating sensitivity.
Deceptively hangs the painting back and puts an 'OUT OF ORDER' sign to cover up the incident.
Hangs the painting back up, closes the security cupboard door, and puts an 'OUT OF ORDER' note on it to cover up the problem.
Appears panicked and struggles to stay calm while considering the consequences of the situation.
Acknowledges the severity of the situation and logically thinks through potential outcomes and repercussions.
Creates a misleading 'OUT OF ORDER' sign and locks the cupboard to hide the mess.
Acts awkwardly and tries to appear natural but is visibly uncomfortable in a social situation.
Participates in conversation with colleagues about the painting in a neutral, cooperative way.
Locks the cupboard carefully to ensure no one sees the damaged painting again.
Acts 'natural' in a socially awkward and exaggerated way when exiting the scene.
Engages in the conversation about the painting's condition intelligently and agrees with the assessment.
Huddles at the thought of choosing paints, shows uncertainty about paint selection skills.
Politely compliments someone’s hair, showing social tact.
Shakes his head when asked if he drinks, showing self-control or clarity.
Has difficulty finding the straw with his mouth and puts the end of a straw up his nose, then puts peanuts in each nostril.
Throws a peanut high into the air and catches it in his mouth multiple times, including with eyes closed, demonstrating a skilled and impressive trick.
Blows a peanut from his nostril to change the TV station to quiet music to allow David to speak.
Listens seriously and looks sad after realizing his actions have negatively affected another person's life.
Carefully gathers an assortment of odd items to prepare for a plan, demonstrating creativity and resourcefulness.
Sneaks into the gallery while the security guard is distracted by a staged suicide scene, indicating deceptive behavior.
Carefully collects a variety of unusual objects to prepare for his plan, showing resourcefulness and creativity.
Arrives silently on a skateboard, demonstrating stealth and physical coordination.
Uses a creative distraction (Action Man doll) to mislead the security guard.
Pours laxative into Buck's coffee to sabotage him, watches Buck suffer, and giggles.
Moves silently with oven gloves on feet and uses humorous methods like y-fronts as a headlamp while carrying out plans.
Puts his finger to his mouth, signals for silence as others are confused; smiles confidently believing he can solve problems.
Instantly takes on the hero's mantle and fixes the bike when David and others struggle.
Sees the bike won't start, quickly takes a screwdriver, fixes the engine, and gets the bike running.
Immediately assumes the role of hero and acts to solve the problem without hesitation.
Gives a shudder and quietly withdraws to the gallery when uncomfortable.
Is asked to be looked after by a child who doubts his intelligence, indicating others perceive him as not very competent.
Enjoys working at the computer and takes initiative to navigate the animated catalogue, showing interest and focus.
Hogs the computer, potentially ignoring others' needs for access.
Smiles and nods nervously to Bernie, indicating cooperation and acknowledging authority.
Absorbed in solving puzzles, showing curiosity but little social engagement.
Types in words on the keyboard, including the name 'Bernie' and 'PERIOD', seemingly trying to solve the puzzle rather than to deceive maliciously.
Absorbed and persistent in trying to solve the computer code puzzle, experimenting with various inputs until he gets 'CODE ACCEPTED'.
Types in random guesses for the password (like 'GOBLIN', 'GNOMES', 'BERNIE') without a clear strategy, showing some trial and error and uncertainty.
Nods nervously when Bernie unexpectedly appears, indicating some uncertainty or lack of confidence in the situation.
Assents happily to help Bernie by parking the Governor's car when asked.
Sneaks into the car and enjoys sitting in it, showing delight in the moment.
Assents happily to park the Governor's car and seizes the opportunity eagerly.
Lets himself into the Governor's car and enjoys the experience, showing enthusiasm but no clear skill or responsibility.
Attempts to park carefully using a comb to measure the space, showing resourcefulness and care.
Causes damage to other cars by squeezing his large car into a space too small, indicating some clumsiness and disregard for others' property.
Panics appropriately when a fire starts on the seat, showing self-preservation rather than coldness or cruelty.
Inspects the car, attempts to fix the bonnet, uses the control booth to drop the barrier successfully.
Forgets to apply the hand brake after stopping the car, which then rolls away and crashes.
Fails to notice the foot-high barrier on the ground, causing the car to stop abruptly.
Tries to politely greet Governor Reynolds with a quick handshake and attempts to leave unnoticed.
Accidentally breaks off the ornate frame from the painting while trying to steady himself, causing horror among the crowd.
Stands silent and destitute in front of the debris, showing vulnerability and accepting forgiveness from David.
Offers no immediate verbal defense or blame, simply lifting hands in a sad gesture.
Involved in a chaotic situation but does not take control or show clear leadership or problem-solving.
Participates in the escape from pursuers alongside David and Kevin, staying with the group during the chase.
Takes off his mask and smiles with a little wave to the patient in pain.
Appears fed up trying to correct people with misconception about his identity.
Nods to allow assistant doctor to proceed without argument.
Accepts mistaken identity as a doctor with resignation and does not try to correct it further.
Is immediately accorded authority by medical staff who outfit him and await his instruction.
Nods silently to the assistant doctor to proceed with surgery, showing passive compliance rather than active leadership.
Smiles and waves at the injured man despite the gravity of the situation, suggesting lack of situational awareness or professionalism.
Snatches the knife from an inexperienced assistant to prevent further harm.
Annoyed by the sweet getting stuck in the wound but quickly recovers and manages the situation.
Rummages inside the body to retrieve the sweet, then notices the bullet and puts it back quietly.
Demonstrates confidence and skill by retrieving the bullet himself, saving the patient's life.
Snatches the knife in horror, notices the assistant's inexperience, and hands the knife to the nurse testily.
Absentmindedly throws a sweet into the air but forgets he's wearing a mask and it falls into the patient's open wound.
Rummages into the body to retrieve the sweet and inadvertently finds the bullet, then slips it back and cleans the sweet before eating it.
Disregards the assistant's X-ray reading, confidently reaches into the wound, and successfully retrieves the bullet himself, earning applause.

Shakes SIDE-KICK's hand nervously after saving his life, looks contrite when ALISON turns away, kicks DAVID in the shins to get his attention and tries to communicate by pointing at the skeleton poster.
Points to himself and nods enthusiastically when asked to explain, showing willingness to engage.
Nods enthusiastically and backs off when asked to keep out of the way, showing respect for others' space.
Shows sympathy in his eyes upon seeing Jennifer for the first time.
Sits down and is determined to help Kevin with the game to keep company and support him.
Sits quietly by Jennifer's bed, thinking about how to help by fixing the Super Nintendo console.
Thinks about how to fix the Super Nintendo console, shows initiative and problem-solving by unscrewing the casing to try and get it working again.
Uses the Super Nintendo game on Jennifer's ECG monitor in an attempt to revive her, despite initial horror from others.
Is happy that everyone is happy after Jennifer wakes up and family members start laughing.
Plugged a Super Nintendo into a medical monitor and used a game character interacting with the pulse light as a way to 'revive' Jennifer, leading to Jennifer waking up.
Determinedly continued an unorthodox method despite confusion or potential risks.
Interrupts an intimate moment between Alison and David impatiently by pointing to his watch.
Beams at Alison appreciatively when she playfully prepares ‘coffee’ using socks in a toaster, feeling accepted.
Looks pleased but quickly adjusts his expression to a more appropriate one after realizing his initial reaction was unsuitable.
Joins in applauding and celebrating Grierson's reveal, appearing relieved and hyperactive with the crowd.
Feels mortified and worried about David being fired and the subsequent events.
Internally refuses the offer to stay with Bernie by thinking 'No! I don't want to stay with horrible Bernie.'
Joins in hyperactively and acts relieved when the original painting is revealed, indicating a reactive rather than proactive approach.
Shows mortified, worried expression during the firing scene, indicating awareness but inability to intervene or manage situation effectively.
No direct action or speech showing skillful or confident handling of the situation; mainly portrayed as a bystander.
Sits at the computer promptly when invited to try the interactive gallery guide.
Disobeys instructions repeatedly by clicking padlock and ignoring the interface, humming a tune.
Turns and snarls at Bernie, almost a bark, when Bernie tries to intervene.
Slowly types 'P-E-R-I-0-D' on the keyboard while humming happily and then throws his hands up in a verbal fanfare.
Punches Bernie sharply in the nose after being accused, sparking applause in the gallery.
Accepts flowers from the side-kick with delight and sniffs them, despite disliking the smell.
Gives stinky flowers to Annie who beams with delight, showing he acknowledges her feelings.
Shoos away David’s affectionate gesture, avoiding any 'sloppiness'.
Firmly shakes Alison’s hand instead of accepting a kiss, maintaining formal distance.
Shakes Jennifer’s broken arm which causes her pain, leading to another scream.
Waves farewell to Alison and Jennifer with a sentimental gesture albeit ends clumsily.
Gives stinky flowers to Annie to get rid of them, showing cleverness in avoiding an awkward situation.
Shoos David away instantly to avoid any sloppy familiarity, demonstrating confident social boundary setting.
Firmly shakes Jennifer's broken arm which causes her to scream again, showing a lack of sensitivity and poor judgment.
Waves his hand out the car window in a sentimental farewell, but accidentally hits the wooden gate, indicating clumsiness.
Does not look back when saying goodbye, nods abruptly, and starts to leave quickly.
Suddenly reappears to give David a big bear hug and a big grin before leaving.
Studies his watch, picks up his case, and leaves promptly without looking back, showing focus and decisiveness.
Surprises David by suddenly tapping on his shoulder and giving a bear hug, then inadvertently treads on someone's shoe.
Enters the National Gallery hopeful and puzzled by the empty galleries, looks around curiously but does not cause disturbance.
Expresses disgust at the empty gallery by grunting and furrowing brow but does not lash out or blame others.
Leaves the National Gallery quietly, seemingly thoughtful about his next steps, showing no signs of bitterness or malice.
Hammering away at a wooden structure at home, continuing with his own project and caring for his teddy with a seatbelt, demonstrating self-care and gentle attachment.
Secures Teddy with a seat belt in the car, showing care for his companion's safety.
Places himself inside a large crate and sends it through complex shipping arrangements, demonstrating resourcefulness but no clear friendly or sincere interaction with others.
Builds a large wooden crate to secretly transport himself and teddy, then successfully arranges for it to be shipped on a plane.
Drives the car directly into the crate he has built, using a rope tied to the back bumper to close the lid behind him, demonstrating creative problem-solving and planning.
No visible errors or failures in the process of executing this plan; the crate is properly labeled and handled, indicating careful preparation.
